content: During the creation of #16542, the issue of a predicate typeclass for the measurable space structure that has all sets measurable came up. This is agreed to be a good idea, but I wonder if we can deduplicate this code and reuse it in many different spaces: we already have filter.ne_bot, discrete_topology, and ne_zero, all of which mean one or more of the above in reasonable cases. I wonder if it's just worth defining them all at a go and leaving them to be used for whatever they are needed
One issue I see is that the notation for the new spelling of discrete_topology would be a bit awkward...
